title: Giants co-owner Tisch named in latest Epstein file...

content: The Seattle Seahawks will go up for sale after Super Bowl LX, league and ownership sources familiar with the arrangement tell ESPN.

title: Jokic returns from injury to net 31 in Nuggets' wi...
content: Nikola Jokic returned to the Nuggets' lineup on Friday night after being sidelined since Dec. 29 with a bone bruise in his hyperextended left knee and had 31 points and 12 rebounds in a 122-109 win over the LA Clippers.

title: Bailey, with 10 games in NBA, seeks NCAA return
content: Former UCLA standout Amari Bailey, who played 10 games for the Hornets in 2023-24, has hired an agent and a lawyer to prepare to fight for NCAA eligibility.

title: Sources: Ravens to hire Doyle, 29, to be new OC
content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

title: Wilson, A's reach agreement on 7-year extension
content: All-Star shortstop Jacob Wilson and the Athletics reached agreement on a seven-year contract that includes a club option for an eighth season, the team announced Friday.

title: Robertson, 40, WS champion with Yankees, retires
content: David Robertson, who recorded 179 saves over a 17-year major league career, announced his retirement Friday.

content: Last year was the first time Chase Elliott won multiple races in a season since 2022. Can he carry that momentum into the 2026 campaign?

content: With Giannis Antetokounmpo rumored to be in his final days with Milwaukee, Andre Snellings takes a look at the possible destinations and which would be best and worst for his fantasy value.

title: 'Unfortunately, Ajit left us before that': Sharad Pawar makes big NCP merger revelation
content: Sharad Pawar revealed merger talks between NCP factions were advanced before Ajit Pawar's death, aiming to fulfill his nephew's wish. He denied prior knowledge of Sunetra Pawar's potential deputy CM role, stating decisions are made in Mumbai without his consultation. Pawar also dismissed speculation about joining the NDA.

title: Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir 'quietly' visited countries to seek loans for Pakistan
content: Pakistan's prime minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed a difficult truth. He and Army Chief Asim Munir sought billions in loans from friendly nations. This was done quietly to bridge the country's external financing gap. Sharif acknowledged the compromises involved in seeking such aid. China was a key supporter. Pakistan has a history of relying on the IMF for financial support.

title: Declare cow ‚Äòrajya mata‚Äô, ban beef export in 40 days: Hindu seer dares UP CM Yogi
content: Swami Avimukteshwaranand has challenged Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to declare the cow 'state mother' and ban beef exports within 40 days. Failure to do so, he warned, will lead to saints gathering in Lucknow on March 11 to label the CM a 'fake Hindu'. The seer emphasized cow protection and dharma as true tests of being Hindu.

title: Inside CJ Roy's luxury car collection: 12 Rolls-Royce, Bugatti, Lamborghinis
content: Real estate tycoon CJ Roy has died. His family blames income tax officials from Kerala for his death. Roy, owner of Confident Group, was under investigation. He had a large social media following. His last post was for Republic Day. The family is expected to arrive in Bengaluru soon. Investigations into the circumstances are ongoing.

title: 'Nahi khelenge': India-Pakistan T20 World Cup final faces shock twist
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Rashid Latif feels Pakistan acted late on the T20 World Cup 2026 issue. The Pakistan Cricket Board awaits government clearance for participation.  Latif suggests the window for a significant protest has closed.  Pakistan's squad departure is scheduled, indicating participation.  A final decision is expected soon.

title: Bill Gates daughter Phoebe reveals a ChatGPT tip she uses at work
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, revealed a unique marketing strategy. She and her co-founder Sophia Kianni utilize ChatGPT to analyze viral videos. They identify successful patterns and then use the AI chatbot to adapt these elements for their fashion tech startup, Phia. This approach helps them create engaging content without starting from scratch.

title: India to buy oil from Venezuela instead of Russia? US pitch to counter 25% tariffs
content: The US has permitted India to resume Venezuelan oil purchases, aiming to reduce its reliance on Russian crude. This move is part of a broader US strategy to redirect India's energy imports away from Russia amidst growing pressure and trade costs. India is set to significantly cut Russian crude imports in the coming months, diversifying its supply sources.

title: ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs a different route‚Äô: Google CEO shares photo of Alex Honnold climbing Taipei 101
content: Climber Alex Honnold achieved a historic feat by free-soloing Taiwan's Taipei 101 skyscraper.  He ascended the 508-meter building without ropes or safety gear.  The climb took about an hour and a half.  Google CEO Sundar Pichai shared photos of the event.  Honnold is known for his daring climbs.

title: Budget 2026 on February 1: Will NSE, BSE remain open for trading on Sunday?
content: Indian stock markets will operate on Sunday, February 1, 2026, for the Union Budget presentation, a rare occurrence. Both BSE and NSE confirmed normal trading hours, with only specialized sessions like T+0 settlement suspended. This marks the first Sunday Budget presentation since 2000, while the year's holiday schedule remains unchanged.

title: Pawar play: Speedy decision on Sunetra as deputy CM to pre-empt takeover by NCP (SP)?
content: Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy chief minister is a strategic move by senior NCP leaders to preemptively quell leadership speculation following her husband's passing. This decision, endorsed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to stabilize the political landscape before the potential merger of NCP factions, ensuring control amidst potential demands from Sharad Pawar's camp.

title: Bengaluru police inspector caught taking Rs 4 lakh bribe, video goes viral
content: A police inspector, Govindaraju, was caught accepting a Rs 4 lakh bribe in Bengaluru. A video surfaced showing him resisting arrest by Lokayukta officials. He allegedly demanded Rs 5 lakh to help a complainant in a cheating case, having already received Rs 1 lakh prior.

title: Tim Cook explains why Apple chose Google, not OpenAI, for the new Siri
content: Apple has chosen Google's advanced Gemini AI for its new Siri and upcoming Apple Intelligence features, prioritizing superior technology over OpenAI. CEO Tim Cook emphasized this collaboration, assuring users of continued privacy standards. While OpenAI's ChatGPT integration remains, it's now seen as secondary. Apple views this AI integration as a significant value creator and potential revenue stream.

title: 'Border 2' marches towards Rs 350 crore mark worldwide
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its box office dominance, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide within its first week. Despite a slight dip on weekdays, the film collected Rs 11 crore on its eighth day, heading towards the Rs 350 crore mark. The war drama has garnered Rs 235.25 crore net in India and Rs 322.5 crore globally.

title: 'Made from synthetic material': CBI rules out mixing of animal fats in Tirupati laddu ghee
content: A CBI chargesheet revealed that ghee supplied to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) was synthetic, not cow ghee, and blended with vegetable oils. Laboratory tests indicated very low milk fat content and the presence of palm oil and/or palm kernel oil. The report suggested the absence of cholesterol made tallow, lard, and fish oil presence very low.

title: Budget 2026 expectations: From HAL to BEL - top defence stocks to watch out for
content: Defence sector stocks: On the whole, the upcoming Indian defence budget outlook, would see ‚Äúcapital step-up‚Äù with at least a 15% increase. Where the structural reality of committed liabilities, would support of a multi-year award cycle.

title: 'Schitt's Creek' actress Catherine O'Hara passes away at 71
content: With deep sadness, we announce the passing of the beloved Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara at the age of 71, following a short illness. Renowned for her unforgettable performances in iconic films like 'Home Alone' and the hit series 'Schitt's Creek,' Catherine's talent blossomed over an impressive career that spanned five decades.

title: Jan AQI worse than last year‚Äôs: Why rain failed to wash away Delhi's pollution pain
content: Despite receiving 33% excess rainfall, January 2026 was more polluted than the previous year, with an average AQI of 307 compared to 305. The month experienced severe air quality days from January 17-19, a first in four years. While the last week saw improvement due to rain, adverse meteorology and high emissions contributed to the overall poor air quality.

title: Red hair not a cosmetic choice, result of medical condition: Odisha DSP
content: DSP Rashmi Ranjan Das recently addressed online backlash regarding his red hair. He explained it's not a fashion statement but a result of a medical condition that started affecting his hair color years ago. He clarified that his vibrant red locks are due to health issues, not a deliberate cosmetic choice.

title: 2-inch land row: Patna man kills 2 over boundary dispute; 1 injured
content: In a tragic turn of events, a small dispute over just two inches of land in Patna‚Äôs Fatuha area erupted into violence, resulting in the death of a 50-year-old woman and her neighbor.

title: Major setback for Pakistan ahead of virtual knockout vs India in U-19 World Cup
content: Pakistan's Under-19 World Cup hopes face a blow as wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Shayan is ruled out due to a fractured nose. This setback comes ahead of their crucial virtual knockout match against India, which will decide the final semi-finalist. Afghanistan and England have already secured their spots in the final four.

title: 'Kept briefcase with pistol close': How Bengaluru businessman's final hours unfolded
content: Confident Group chairman C J Roy, 57, was found dead from a gunshot wound at his Bengaluru office on Friday. The incident occurred shortly after Income Tax officials, who had been conducting searches for three days, asked him to stay to review documents. Roy reportedly went into his cabin and a gunshot was heard minutes later.

title: Op Trashi-I Day 14: Security forces make contact with terrorists in J&K's Dolgam
content: Security forces re-established contact with terrorists early Saturday in Dolgam, Jammu and Kashmir, initiating Operation Trashi-I. This follows an intensified anti-terror operation in Kishtwar against Jaish terrorists, which saw internet services suspended. Previous encounters in Kishtwar, despite challenging terrain and casualties, resulted in militants evading capture.

title: Landslide leads to mine collapse in Congo; over 200 killed
content: A devastating landslide caused a mine collapse in Rubaya, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Over 200 people, including miners, children, and market women, lost their lives. The incident occurred at a coltan mine, a vital source for global technology. Authorities are still assessing the exact casualty count. The collapse is attributed to heavy seasonal rains weakening the ground.

title: 'Gambhir under lot of pressure': Bavuma fires warning at India head coach
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma believes Indian coach Gautam Gambhir faces significant pressure in Test cricket, despite white-ball successes. Bavuma suggests Gambhir needs time to navigate the team's transition, with limited-overs strength potentially offering breathing room. He advocates for continuity in coaching roles, backing Gambhir through the challenging red-ball period.

title: Trump administration to add roughly 65,000 H-2B guest worker visas this year
content: The Trump administration is releasing an additional 65,000 H-2B seasonal guest worker visas, nearly doubling the annual allocation. This move aims to alleviate financial hardship for businesses in sectors like hospitality and construction, which have reported labor shortages. The decision comes amidst broader immigration policies and follows similar visa expansions under previous administrations.

title: Delhi man critical after taking HIV preventive drugs on AI advice
content: A man in Delhi is battling a severe health crisis after taking HIV post-exposure medication without a prescription, guided by an AI chatbot. This reckless decision led to a rare and serious condition known as Stevens-Johnson syndrome.

title: MLB trade rumors: Braves eye $35m Cubs star; Robert Suarez key trade asset
content: A hypothetical trade sees the Atlanta Braves acquiring versatile infielder Nico Hoerner from the Chicago Cubs for hard-throwing reliever Robert Suarez. This move addresses Atlanta's infield void due to injury, while Chicago secures a much-needed closer. Both players are in their prime with multi-year control, making it a balanced, win-now exchange.

title: 'Emotionally exhausted': Travis Kelce spoke to Taylor Swift‚Äôs parents for support?
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce got engaged in August 2025 and many expected the two to tie the knot this summer. Now, roughly six months after the lavish proposal, it seems the high profile couple are going through a rough patch as Travis Kelce deals with retirement rumors while Taylor Swift goes through legal trouble and might be called to court.

title: NHL trade rumors: Artemi Panarin seeks $50m extension, complicates talks
content: Star player Artemi Panarin seeks a massive $50 million contract extension. This demand complicates his potential trade from the New York Rangers. Several teams have expressed interest in acquiring Panarin. The Florida Panthers are reportedly a top choice for the player. Panarin is in the final year of his current contract. His future team will be decided soon.

title: Bahraini rapper enters Guinness World Records as Fa9la from Dhurandhar tops charts
content: Bahraini rapper Flipperachi has officially entered the Guinness World Records after his song Fa9la (pronounced Faasla), featured in Ranveer Singh‚Äôs blockbuster Dhurandhar, topped the Arabia Charts with the highest number of billboards. The achievement has propelled the artist into the spotlight in India, where the track has gone viral alongside Akshaye Khanna‚Äôs now-iconic entry sequence in the film.

title: Epstein Files: Justice department temporarily removes document related to Trump and Jeffrey
content: The Justice Department briefly released and re-published a file containing FBI complaint summaries mentioning Jeffrey Epstein and Donald Trump.  These unverified complaints, some dating back 35 years, also referenced Bill Clinton and Lisa Marie Presley.  Notably, some complainants provided no contact details, and one email indicated second-hand information was included.

title: Premiere promo fights: New 'The 50' clip shows Rajat, Digvijay clash
content: Get ready for 'The 50,' a new reality show premiering February 1st, packed with drama! Promos reveal explosive fights between Rajat Dalal and Digvijay Singh Rathee, a heated exchange between Sapna Chaudhary and Adnaan Shaikh, and a fierce verbal clash between Karan Patel and Siddharth Bharadwaj. Nikki Tamboli also expresses a desire for an opponent's aggressive exit.

title: After T20 World Cup exit, BCB reveals Shakib's roadmap for next ICC tournament
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board is planning Shakib Al Hasan's return to the national team.  The veteran all-rounder could play in the upcoming series against Pakistan.  Batting coach Mohammad Ashraful believes Shakib should aim for the 2027 ODI World Cup.  Shakib's personal security and legal issues are being addressed.  His comeback is a significant development for Bangladesh cricket.

title: ‚ÄòBorder 2‚Äô Box Office: Deol‚Äôs film leads with Rs 235 crore
content: The war epic 'Border 2' has achieved a remarkable feat, crossing the Rs 200 crore mark within its first week. Early estimates suggest an Rs 11 crore collection on its 8th day, pushing the total earnings to an impressive Rs 235.25 crores.  Despite facing competition from 'Mardaani 3', the film continues to draw audiences, with Jaipur showing strong occupancy.

title: From bricks to blockbusters: How CJ Roy turned Bengaluru‚Äôs fringe into fortune
content: CJ Roy transformed from managing his mother's real estate accounts to becoming a wealthy developer by betting on overlooked land along Sarjapur Road. This foresight, honed by early exposure to property transactions, led him to launch Confident Group and capitalize on Bengaluru's tech boom, achieving spectacular returns.

title: 'Cops can't play role of judiciary': HC slams UP police on encounters
content: The Allahabad High Court has strongly criticized UP Police for frequent encounters, particularly below-the-knee shootings, citing a disregard for judicial authority.  Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deshwal mandated specific guidelines for all police-criminal encounters, emphasizing that punishment is the judiciary's role, not the police's.  Failure to comply will be treated as contempt.

title: Sunetra Pawar set to take oath as Maharashtra deputy CM today
content: Sunetra Pawar is poised to become Maharashtra's deputy chief minister, a historic first for the state. Following her husband Ajit Pawar's tragic passing, the Rajya Sabha MP is expected to be sworn in on Saturday. Her elevation to the deputy CM post may necessitate a contest for the Baramati by-election.

title: Epstein files: Did Musk plan to visit Epstein‚Äôs private island? Here‚Äôs what new documents reveal
content: New documents reveal Elon Musk's communications with Jeffrey Epstein. Emails show Musk inquiring about visiting Epstein's island during the holidays. Epstein invited Musk, suggesting dates in early January. The documents indicate a level of contact previously unknown. Musk had previously stated he refused Epstein's invitations to the island.

title: Peeyush Pandey is new acting West Bengal DGP, major rejig ahead of Assembly polls
content: Police Commissionerate of Howrah, Bidhannagar, Barrackpore and  Chandannagar will get new police chiefs

title: Patna NEET aspirant death case: Nitish Kumar recommends CBI probe
content: The decision came a day after the parents of the girl met Bihar Director General of Police (DGP) Vinay Kumar at his residence alleging that the state police was trying to hush up the matter

content: The meeting between CPI(M) State secretary Md. Salim and Janata Unnayan Party founder Humayun Kabir signals fresh alignment ahead of the Assembly polls in West Bengal

title: Kerala for All conclave LIVE: Two-day conclave to focus on inclusive and accessible tourism
content: The two-day conclave on inclusive and accessible tourism will be held on January 31, 2026 and February 1, 2026 in Kochi organised by Kerala Tourism in partnership with The Hindu Group

title: No idea about Sunetra Pawar being sworn in as Maharashtra Deputy CM, says Sharad Pawar
content: Sunetra Pawar reached Devgiri, the official residence of her late husband in south Mumbai, accompanied by son Parth

content: The new social media guidelines will be applied to all government officers from senior to lower-level employees

title: Nashik farmers conclude long march after Maharashtra government agrees to demands
content: The State Government assured that forest landholders across the state would apply for the re-examination of their land claims

title: Sunetra Pawar reaches Mumbai, all set to become Maharashtra first woman Deputy CM
content: NCP's legislature wing will hold a meeting in Mumbai on Saturday (January 31, 2026) afternoon where she would be named as its leader, State minister and senior party leader Chhagan Bhujbal said

title: From ‚ÄòSamskara‚Äô to ‚ÄòKaatera‚Äô: Caste resistance & representation in Kannada cinema | Decode Karnataka
content: Kannada cinema has often spoken about class divide and social reform, but when it comes to caste, the lens turns cautious.

title: Security forces re-establish contact with terrorists in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar, operation underway
content: The Army said intelligence inputs from all sources were coordinated to plan and execute the operation on the ground

title: India‚Äôs role in shaping global thinking on patient safety highlighted at Apollo Hospitals International Health Dialogue 2026
content: The international conference brought together doctors, policymakers, digital health professionals and experts to discuss ways to build safer and more equitable healthcare systems

title: Expectations from a gender lens in Budget 2026-27
content: What the Budget could do to unlock women‚Äôs time, productivity, and participation in India‚Äôs growth story

title: Regime in tough spot as every Iranian has been affected by economic collapse, says Scott Anderson
content: Journalist and writer Scott Anderson says, unlike during earlier protests in Iran, the regime can no longer play one group off against another, because everyone is suffering; the economic collapse, food and water crises, and high unemployment rate cannot all be blamed on foreign saboteurs, he adds

title: Stalin set to visit Sivaganga district
content: The CM is also scheduled to take part in the centenary celebrations of Thavathiru Kundrakkudi Adigalar, an official release said

title: Vande Mataram should be sung in its entirety across the country: K. Annamalai
content: At an event organised by Tamil Perayam, he read out the later stanzas of the poem and a Tamil translation of them

title: PDP‚Äôs Parra introduces ‚ÄòJ&K Reconciliation, Trauma Healing and Dignity‚Äô Bill in Assembly
content: According to the Bill, J&K has witnessed prolonged violence, armed conflict, terrorism and political instability, resulting in widespread psychological trauma, displacement, grief, loss of dignity and erosion of social trust

title: NC‚Äôs MP Ramzan meets Palestinian Minister in Delhi, expresses solidarity
content: The NC spokesman said Dr. Aghabekian on January 29 briefed the attendees on the current political developments and the prevailing ground and humanitarian situation in Palestine

title: 2026 UGC equity rules: Cracks on campus
content: Students from the general category or upper castes believe that the UGC‚Äôs 2026 regulations, introduced mainly to address caste discrimination on campuses, will create a divide and villainise them. They worry about several of its provisions, including the lack of protection against false complaints. While the Supreme Court has stayed the regulations, anger has not yet subsided, report Abhinay Lakshman and Mayank Kumar

title: BJP MLA confronts U.P. Minister over delayed water projects in Mahoba, video went viral
content: After the video of the incident went viral, the Samajwadi Party (SP) president Akhilesh Yadav targeted the BJP government, alleging that BJP ministers or MLAs are busy making money and grabbing land, with none of them are working for the public or for development needs.

title: Challenges stacked against Sunetra Pawar, who will take charge in a turbulent political scenario, amid a flux in two parties
content: For the NCP, it is now a battle for survival, where the legislators and cadres will not find any other face acceptable as a leadership option

title: Indian-origin printing firm boss convicted of COVID loan fraud in U.K.
content: Prashant Jobanputra is said to have ‚Äúfraudulently declared‚Äù on the second application that this was the only Bounce Back Loan he had applied for.

title: Rajasthan Assembly witnesses heated exchanges over ‚ÄòSIR irregularities‚Äô issue
content: When the House reassembled, Mr. Jully requested that a half-hour discussion on the allegations of SIR irregularities be allowed in the light of a debate on electoral reforms held in Lok Sabha recently.

title: A soldier few know, a record few can match: Brigadier Henry Bhaskar‚Äôs journey through two wars and beyond
content: A frontline officer in the 1965 and 1971 wars, Brigadier Bhaskar went on to become the first chairman of the Chittagong Port Trust in newly liberated Bangladesh after leading Indian troops into the strategic harbour city

title: When the sea became a shared responsibility for scientists and people living along the coast
content: Over the past two decades, INCOIS‚Äôs Wave Monitoring Along Nearshore (WAMAN) buoy network has been transforming India‚Äôs coastal forecasting by combining science with community trust. With 17 nearshore buoys and active local participation, WAMAN delivers real-time wave data that strengthens early warnings, supports fishers and ports, and ensures long-term, sustainable ocean observation

title: AI171 crash probe: AAIB assessing various aspects; nothing has been ruled out, says source
content: According to a report on January 30, the probe might be leaning towards deliberate pilot action as the probable cause for the accident

title: How can State government squat on private property, asks Madras High Court Chief Justice
content: Denies interim relief to the government in a case related to rental dispute between Tambaram Police Commissionerate and its landlords

title: Maharashtra Zilla Parishad elections postponed to February 7: SEC
content: According to the SEC, the Supreme Court has allowed an extension of two weeks for these elections beyond January 31

content: He also asserts that the issue has not been resolved in the DMK-led front, with the Congress drifting from the alliance

title: SIR in Bengal: Cricketer Jhulan Goswami summoned for hearing

title: In a ‚Äòfirst‚Äô for PMK, Anbumani interviews ticket aspirants
content: Sources say the interviews have created a buzz among the aspirants, who have had a chance to meet with the leadership and speak about their work within the party

title: Roy and his love for Rolls Royce
content: The businessman found dead on Friday was an avid luxury cars enthusiast, often posting about them on his social media account

title: Venezuela's acting President Rodriguez dials PM Modi, agrees to take bilateral ties to new heights
content: ‚ÄúWe agreed to further deepen and expand our bilateral partnership in all areas, with a shared vision of taking India-Venezuela relations to new heights in the years ahead,‚Äù PM Modi said

title: Confident Group was one of the first to move into Sarjapur
content: Owner C.J. Roy, who shot himself to death, had turned the fate to his favor by acquiring over 300 acres land much before real estate boom in Bengaluru

title: Supreme Court sets aside Madras HC order asking accused to marry for bail
content: Advocates representing the accused-petitioner submitted before the apex court that asking their client to actually marry the woman, even before the charges were proved against him, would amount to pre-judging the allegation that he had made the promise of wedlock

title: ED arrests former RCom director Punit Garg
content: The arrest was made on Thursday (January 29, 2026) as part of the ED probe with respect to a First Information Report registered by the Central Bureau of Investigation

title: Roy sought time to talk to mother and shot himself in adjoining room, say police sources
content: Roy‚Äôs wife, son and daughter, based in Dubai, are expected to reach Bengaluru on Saturday (January 31, 2026)

title: Phone tapping case: KCR asked to be available for questioning on February 1
content: The police declined to conduct the examination at his farmhouse, saying the venue must correspond to the ordinary place of residence in official records

title: Uttarakhand-like attacks forcing Kashmir youth to look inwards: Omar Abdullah
content: ‚ÄúWe have seen what our people have faced outside in recent times, whether it was in Himachal Pradesh or what happened recently in Uttarakhand. As a result, our people are now looking inward rather than going outside,‚Äù said J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

title: CBFC files caveat in Supreme Court in Jana Nayagan case
content: A caveat is filed by a litigant in the High Courts and the Supreme Court to ensure that no adverse order is passed against it without it being heard

title: Bangladeshi national arrested in Agartala allegedly involved in human trafficking
content: The detainee reportedly confessed to his involvement in trafficking Bangladeshi nationals through different border routes

title: 2-year Central deputation at SP/DIG level must for IPS officers to be eligible for senior posts: MHA
content: The MHA writes to States that a minimum of two years of Central experience at SP/DIG or equivalent level will be mandatory for empanelment of IPS officers at IG/equivalent level at the Centre from the 2011 batch onwards.

title: Unions question apex court‚Äôs comment linking aggressive unionism to industrial stagnation
content: These observations of the Supreme Court coupled with its refusal to entertain a plea seeking minimum wages for domestic workers, are deeply concerning, the AITUC said

title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha set to campaign against India-EU trade deal
content: The opening of the processed food market will have a larger and disastrous impact on domestic agricultural production and small farmers, the Samyukt Kisan Morcha says in a statement

title: Resurvey 2.0 should be error free, says A.P. Revenue Minister
content: Minister says government has extended timeline to 140 days to allow thorough verification, instructs officials to actively involve landowners at every stage and defer surveys if farmers concerned are not present

title: Karnataka bans tobacco-related advertisements on RTC buses after public backlash
content: The decision comes amid growing protests by Kannada activists in Bengaluru and other parts of the state who have recently been removing tobacco-related advertisements from RTC buses.

title: High tap coverage under Jal Jeevan scheme, but lower usage, reliability
content: Water flowed through taps in only 83% of households, and only 76% had water that met standards for e-coli, faecal coliform, pH levels

title: Bihar Govt. to cover entire fees for SC & ST students enrolled in NIT, IIT, AIIMS, NIFT and CIMP
content: The State Government also increased the annual fee paid by the department to SC and ST students in non government institutions in the state

title: A.P. rejects Telangana‚Äôs demand for 50:50 sharing of Krishna waters
content: Pointing out that diversion surplus water from Polavaram project will not harm the upper riparian States, A.P. urges CWC to issue clear allocation guidelines

title: PMK founder Ramadoss files case against son Anbumani‚Äôs claim before Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan are slated to hear his writ petition on February 2, 2026

title: Lokesh urges Centre to permit CSR funding for R&D in institutions
content: Nearly twenty experts have been consulted at Davos to build an ecosystem supporting Quantum Valley proposed in Andhra Pradesh, said Mr. Lokesh during ‚ÄòHello Lokesh‚Äô programme

title: Coastal high-tide flooding declared State-specific disaster
content: Financial assistance similar to that provided to natural disaster victims under the State Disaster Response Fund norms will be given to those affected

title: Breakaway Jamaat-e-Islami faction in Kashmir claims recognition by ECI, pledges to ‚Äòwork within Constitutional framework‚Äô
content: India and Pakistan are two nuclear states and will resolve issues through dialogue, and J&K has no role in it, says JDF-J&K chief patron Ghulam Qadir Lone

title: Kerala for All: 2-day conclave will focus on inclusive tourism
content: Policymakers, industry leaders, designers, economists, accessibility practitioners, and travellers will share the stage on the first day as it will bring together policy intent, expert perspectives, lived experience, and design practice to debate on the central question of what it will take to make tourism truly inclusive.

title: Sunetra Pawar set to be first woman Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra
content: CM says government will support NCP decision; Parth Pawar likely to replace his mother as a Rajya Sabha MP; reunification not a priority, says NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal, even as some NCP-SP leaders push for it

title: BRS spreading lies on govt. efforts to protect State‚Äôs rightful share in river water: Uttam
content: The Minister for Irrigation says Centra has not given any clearance to PNLP so far incl. for its pre-feasibility report

title: Sharad Pawar's Big Remark On Sunetra Pawar Getting Deputy Post
content: The decision to make Sunetra Pawar Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra was taken by the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the family was not consulted, said Ajit Pawar's uncle and NCP-SP Chief, Sharad Pawar.

title: Nestle Acknowledges Delay Before Baby Milk Recall
content: Swiss food giant Nestle has acknowledged that it waited days for a health-risk analysis before alerting authorities after detecting a toxin in its baby milk at a Dutch factory.

title: 'Sanctuary Cities' On Front Line Of Trump Immigration Crackdown
content: US cities that protect their undocumented migrant residents have been thrust into the spotlight by the Trump administration's aggressive immigration crackdown, currently targeting Minneapolis.

title: Lakhs Face Another Arctic Blast Without Power As East Coast Preps For New Storm
content: As tens of thousands of people endured nearly a week with no electricity, another storm loomed on the East Coast where residents braced for near-hurricane force winds, heavy snow and potential flooding.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Mother Mira Nair Named In Epstein Files
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's mother, Mira Nair, attended an afterparty at convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell's house for her 2009 film "Amelia", reveals a new set of Epstein files.

title: "Come Home": J&K Woman's Last Plea To Terrorist Son Goes Unheard
content: Jana Begum's final wish months ago went unheeded by her son Riaz Ahmed, who joined the ranks of the Hizbul Mujahideen, never to return home.

title: Was Sex Offender Epstein Invited To Buckingham Palace? A Big Revelation
content: King Charles III's brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor appeared to invite Jeffrey Epstein to Buckingham Palace shortly after the late sex offender was released from house arrest.

title: US Justice Dept Opens Civil Rights Probe Into Alex Pretti Shooting
content: The U.S. Justice Department has started a civil rights investigation intothe fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by a federal immigration officer in Minneapolis, a senior official said.

title: Kevin Warsh: From Crisis-Era Fed Governor To Trump's Preferred Chair
content: President Donald Trump says he'll tap former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair to replace Jerome Powell in May ‚Äî with Trump believing that he can finally get the booming economy that he promised to voters.

title: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin To 'Pause' Space Tourism To Focus On Moon Efforts
content: Jeff Bezos's space company Blue Origin said Friday it would temporarily pause flights of its space tourism rocket to focus more resources on its lunar ambitions.

title: Trump, Bill Gates, Elon Musk: Notable Names In Epstein File Dump
content: A fresh cache of files related to the investigation into the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein contains documents that reference President Donald Trump and other high-profile figures.

title: Red Fort Blast Module Planned Attacks On Global Coffee Chain: Sources
content: The probe into the car blast near Delhi's Red Fort on November 10 last year has exposed a much larger terror plan, with the sources saying the same module had plotted attacks on outlets of a global coffee chain.

title: Blog: Blog | Sunetra Pawar: From Behind The Scenes To Pinnacle Of Power
content: Right now, the spotlight is not on a seasoned politician from the Pawar family, but a face that has spent decades observing the machinery of governance from behind the scenes: Sunetra Pawar, affectionately known as 'vahini' (sister-in-law).

title: US Approves Arms Sales To Israel Worth $6.67 Billion And To Saudi Worth $9 Billion
content: The Trump administration has approved a massive new series of arms sales to Israel totaling $6.67 billion and to Saudi Arabia worth $9 billion.

title: Venezuela Opens Up Oil Sector: What Now?
content: Parliament on Thursday approved a reform of Venezuela's Hydrocarbons Law, tightened under socialist ex-leader Hugo Chavez in 2006 to entrench state control over a resource Venezuela has more of than any other country on Earth.

title: Government Teacher Arrested For Sexual Assault Of Class 1 Girl In Madhya Pradesh
content: A teacher posted in a government school in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district was arrested for an alleged sexual assault of a minor girl, a police official said.

title: Delhi Records Second-Best Air Quality Month Since 2022
content: The air quality in Delhi has shown slight deterioration this January compared to last year, with the average Air Quality Index (AQI) till January 30 standing at 307, compared to 306 during the same period in 2025, according to an analysis

title: "To Ensure Ajit Pawar's Vision Is Fulfilled, I Will Oversee Budget": D Fadnavis
content: In the wake of the sudden vacuum created by the passing of Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Friday moved to ensure administrative continuity and political stability.

title: Nvidia's Plan To Invest Up To $100 Billion In OpenAI Has Stalled: Report
content: The United States said Friday it had approved a $3.8 billion sale to Israel of 30 Apache attack helicopters and related equipment, as a fragile ceasefire is in place in Gaza.

title: US Clears Nearly $4 Billion To Sell 30 Apache Helicopters To Israel
content: The United States said Friday it had approved a $3.8 billion sale to Israel of 30 Apache attack helicopters and related equipment, as a fragile ceasefire is in place in Gaza.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, each team's...

title: WWE 'SmackDown': Live results and analysis
content: The go-home "SmackDown" ahead of the Royal Rumble ended in chaos, potentially a sign of things to come on Saturday at Royal Rumble. Drew McIntyre dragged Sami Zayn out of the ring during an 8-man tag main event featuring The Vision challenging Zayn, Cody Rhodes, Randy Orton and Jey Uso, which led to a DQ. Jacob Fatu joined the fun and attacked McIntyre, with& Bron Breakker closing "SmackDown" by spearing Rhodes and Zayn. Earlier in the show, Carmelo Hayes defended his United States Championship against Rey Fenix in an open challenge match, AJ Styles and Gunther traded verbal jabs on the mic, and the team of Charlotte Flair and Alexa Bliss defeated Liv Morgan and Roxanne Perez from The Judgement Day. Arda Ocal broke down all the action from "SmackDown" in Riyadh.
